articles.name: Release notes through 2025-4-11
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-4-11
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • Support
  • AI agents and knowledge
  • App Marketplace
  • Zendesk WFM
  • Products with no updates this week

Support

New:

  • EAP launch of Action Builder, which provides a new and simplified way for teams to manage and automate workflows across multiple systems without requiring any coding.

AI agents and knowledge

New:
  • Dialogue builder versioning is now available, allowing users to save, preview, and restore drafts and published versions and add notes.
  • Changing "Link to reply" nodes to "Link to..." nodes. Sunshine Conversations chat users can now use the "Auto-select reply method" when selecting replies. The option relies on the use case configuration, picking procedures or dialogues based on settings. The option also picks the relevant language reply when using dialogues. Auto-select is unavailable to other CRM users and email automation AI Agents.
Fixed:
  • Fixed issue with intent list frequency not being displayed.
  • Fixed an issue where adding the same bot multiple times for a user was possible.
  • Hid the delete bot button from clientAdmin user to avoid unnecessary 401 errors.
  • Automated resolutions in autoreplies with articles - Tickets created via API and Classic Web Widget channels that utilize the autoreplies with article triggers were previously not counted as automated resolutions if they met the definition.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Torvalds.Dev (Support)
    • Torvalds.Dev helps your Zendesk agents resolve tickets faster and more effectively by providing instant insights from your organization's knowledge base. The app intelligently retrieves relevant information, offering contextual hints and suggestions to streamline ticket resolution.  By analyzing internal data and resources, Torvalds.Dev ensures your agents have the most relevant and up-to-date information, allowing them to craft well-informed responses and resolve issues confidently.
  • Reply Assistant (Support)
    • Reply Assistant empowers agents by using AI to generate smart, context-aware replies based on ticket history. With instant response generation and built-in customization, agents can refine AI-suggested replies before sending them. Available directly in the ticket editor, Reply Assistant helps streamline workflows and improve response efficiency while ensuring customer data remains secure.
  • Hide User Fields (Support)
    • Hide User Fields allows you to hide specific user fields from the agent interface, helping reduce visual clutter and streamline workflows. Whether managing dozens or thousands of users, this tool gives you complete control over which user fields are visible so agents see only the most relevant information.
  • Zoho Lens AR Remote Assistance (Support)
    • Zoho Lens AR Remote Assistance empowers technicians to provide augmented reality (AR) remote assistance directly from Zendesk support tickets. This integration boosts productivity, enhances customer satisfaction, and simplifies complex issue resolution with real-time visual collaboration
  • CXC Latam Insights (Support)
    • CXC Latam Insights helps you instantly analyze your entire Zendesk configuration and detect issues with triggers, automations, macros, routing rules, agent settings, and more, making troubleshooting faster and easier.  Quickly identify and resolve issues without manually reviewing each trigger, automation, or macro. Get clear, actionable insights for immediate solutions—no guesswork!  Get real-time insights into your Zendesk usage, optimize your plan, and maximize your value and efficiency.
  • Accoil (Support) (Sell)
    • Accoil for Support and Sell helps you track customer health based on product usage and identifies high-intent leads and expansion opportunities with usage insights.  Accoil calculates health scores based on product usage, giving support and sales teams clear, actionable insights inside Zendesk Support and Zendesk Sell.
  • Lionbridge Smart Connect Messaging (Support)
    • Lionbridge Smart Connect Messaging provides contact centers, service desks, IT helpdesks, and other organizations with a cost-effective alternative to hiring bilingual staff: AI-based technology. Lionbridge’s translation solution allows organizations to instantly add interaction support for more than 100 languages using their existing staff – with no IT involvement required.  Lionbridge Smart Connect Chat eliminates the need to staff across all languages while providing stakeholders with real-time, low-effort experiences in their native language, with terminology customized for your company and your industry.
  • Archer One (Theme)
    • Archer One provides a modern, responsive layout that makes customizing your help center a breeze. Get started with an engaging design featuring multiple category boxes, along with a fully customizable header and footer. This flexible structure not only helps organize your content in a visually appealing way but also ensures that your users can easily navigate your help center.
  • Revolion (Theme)
    • Revolion is a fully responsive, modern, and professional Zendesk Guide Help Center theme for a seamless customer support experience. Perfect for businesses of all sizes, Revolion empowers organizations to create an intuitive, self-service help center—no coding required. Every element is fully customizable and brand-ready, allowing users to easily launch a professional, on-brand support hub.
  • Thank You Autosolve (Support) (paid)
    • Thank You Autosolve uses AI-driven reasoning to determine whether a reopened ticket’s reply is genuinely a gratitude-only message, where no further action is needed. If it is, the ticket is automatically solved. If not, it remains open for the agent to review.

Zendesk WFM

New:

  • Audit logs: events related to Time off management have been added to the WFM Audit logs page.

Fixed:

  • Reporting and Monitoring:

    • [Report] Fixed a bug that allowed agents to see metrics other than their own in custom reports, even when their permissions did not allow it.

    • [Report] Resolved a bug in the occupancy and utilization calculations; when grouped by activity type only, the calculations were not returning the correct values.

    • [Agent Attendance] The Occupancy Rate metric value is now consistent across the UI (in the Occupancy column and Summary panel) and in the exported CSV files.

    • [Agent Activity] For customers with UAS integration, a bug that caused the incorrect color to display for the "Away" status has been fixed. Previously, "Away" was shown in gray, the color designated for offline statuses.

    • [Agent Activity] For customers with UAS integration, the page now only displays clock-in and clock-out times that reflect the start and end of day events.

    • [WFM Public API EAP] Customers were receiving a 403 error from a problem originating from an issue with the way roles were being set in the request. That is fixed now.
  • Roles and Permissions:
    • Team managers are now part of the team's scope.

Products with no updates this week

  • Talk
  • Advanced AI
  • Chat and messaging
  • Admin Center
  • Explore
  • Mobile
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: What trigger conditions and actions are available for customers on the Essential plan?
articles.title: What trigger conditions and actions are available for customers on the Essential plan?
articles.body:
Question

What trigger conditions and actions are available for customers on the Essential plan?

Answer

On the Essential plan, customers are limited to conditions and actions that are present in the default triggers.

The conditions are as follows:

  • Ticket > Assignee
  • Ticket > Comment
  • Ticket > Priority
  • Ticket > Privacy
  • Ticket > Status
  • Ticket > Ticket
  • Ticket details > Current User
  • Requester > Requester

The available actions are as follows:

  • Notify by > User email

For more information on the default triggers, see these articles:

  • About the Support default triggers
  • Trigger conditions and actions reference

articles.name: Emergency Maintenance - April 21, 2025 | Pod 27 | Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.title: Emergency Maintenance - April 21, 2025 | Pod 27 | Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact performance for some customers using Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging) on Pod 27 on April 21, 2025, during the time listed below.

Affected products: Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging)

Important: Only customers with Messaging triggers enabled are impacted by this maintenance window. Admins can check this by browsing to the Messaging triggers page under Admin Center>>Objects and rules. If you see this page, your account will be impacted by this maintenance. If you do not see it, your account will not be affected.
Customers Affected: Some Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging only) customers on Pod 27 using our improved Messaging backend will experience a brief service disruption of 20 minutes at some time within the 2 hour maintenance window.

Date (UTC)

POD

Start Time

End Time

Mon - April 21, 2025

27

06:00 UTC /
23:00 PDT (Apr 20)

8:00 UTC /
1:00 PDT

Expected behavior:

There will be degraded Messaging performance on all Messaging Channels for up to 20 mins during the window, and your agents may experience delayed ticket creation and end user messages sent to Agent Workspace.

No data will be lost due to this process, and service will resume seamlessly once the maintenance completes.

Outside of the specific windows outlined in the table above, customers should not experience any service impact.

What do customers have to do?

Customers are recommended not to set ticket status to Closed for ongoing Messaging tickets that are open during the maintenance window so that any delayed messages can still be appended to the ticket after database maintenance is completed. If an ongoing messaging ticket is closed during the maintenance window, messages not yet appended to the transcript could create a new ticket.

No further action is required.

 

Why we're doing this: The Zendesk Messaging team is performing this maintenance work to improve the stability and scalability (storage capacity and general performance improvements) of datastores in the new Messaging Backend (see article). This allows us to improve reliability and performance for existing and future customers to the new Messaging Backend.

articles.name: Activating and deactivating Google Calendar for Zendesk WFM
articles.title: Activating and deactivating Google Calendar for Zendesk WFM
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Add-on Workforce Management (WFM) or Workforce Engagement Management (WEM)

Admins can allow agents to sync their Zendesk WFM intraday schedule with their Google calendar.

To activate or deactivate the Google Calendar integration for Zendesk WFM

  1. In Zendesk WFM, hover over the admin icon () in the navigation bar.
  2. Under Integrations, select or deselect Google Calendar.

  3. If you're deactivating the integration, click Deactivate integration in the dialog that appears.

    When you deactivate the Google Calendar integration, the connection between the agents' schedule and their Google calendars isn't removed. Agents must disconnect their calendars from their schedule as well.

  4. Refresh Zendesk after the integration is activated or deactivated.

    If you've activated the Google Calendar integration for WFM, agents can now sync their Google calendars with their WFM schedules.

articles.name: Service Incident - April 8th, 2025
articles.title: Service Incident - April 8th, 2025
articles.body:
SUMMARY

April 08, 2025 04:21 PM UTC | April 08, 2025 09:21 AM PT
We are pleased to inform you that the issue of the QA Scorecards failing to load in Zendesk QA on multiple pods has been resolved. Our engineers confirmed that the fix was successful. We thank you for your patience on this issue.

We continue to investigate the issue of the QA Scorecards failing to load in Zendesk QA on multiple pods. Our engineers have rolled back some potentially problematic changes. We appreciate your patience and we will provide the next update in 30 minutes.

April 08, 2025 03:02 PM UTC | April 08, 2025 08:02 AM PT
We have received reports of the QA Scorecards failing to load in Zendesk QA on multiple pods. We are currently engaging our engineers to assist with this issue. Investigation is underway. We apologize for this inconvenience and we will be providing the next update in 30 minutes.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-4-4
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-4-4
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • AI agents and knowledge
  • Advanced AI
  • App Marketplace
  • Zendesk WFM
  • Products with no updates this week

AI agents and knowledge

AI Agents Advanced

New:

  • The new Product Tray (v2) is now available for provisioned customers on AI Agents Advanced.

Fixed:

  • Salesforce escalations were failing when bot shepherd restarted the bot. This has now been fixed.

Knowledge

New:

  • Rollout started for generative search.
  • Updated CSAT strings in Messaging. Instead of the static string “Please rate your conversation,” a CSAT is now shown.
  • We've added the ability to Embedded Figma files in help center articles.

Advanced AI

New:

Similar Tickets

  • Released improvements to the Similar Tickets EAP.

Auto-assist

New:

  • Action linking: Improved action management allows admins to link actions directly in procedures to ensure auto assist performs the correct action.
  • Brand segmentation: Adding brands to procedures is designed to improve the segmentation of procedures and to ensure that auto-assist uses brand-specific procedures to solve brand-specific problems.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Process DOCX (Support)
    • Process DOCX automatically extracts and uses data from DOC and DOCX files by using AI-powered data extraction to automatically process Microsoft Word files – from written and formatted text to images and tables. The extracted information is added to the ticket and can be used to automatically update ticket fields, trigger other automation workflows, or integrate with third-party systems.
  • SATRDÉ Asset Manager (Support) (paid)
    • SATRDÉ Asset Manager lets you download your assets, mass-edit, and view all assets tied to users on tickets by using custom objects. The SATRDÉ Asset Manager is designed to work with the latest version of custom objects. Set up custom objects and download them into CSV files one at a time or simultaneously. Additionally, a ticket sidebar component will display assets tied to the ticket requester. All you have to do is set up your custom object with a customer look-up relationship field.
  • Financedesk (Theme)
    • Financedesk is a fully responsive multipurpose help center (Guide) theme. The theme is the perfect balance between style and performance. The elements of the help center are arranged in a way that keeps navigation super-easy. The theme comes with a refined image on the side of the search box. It has an impressive full-screen layout with beautiful blocks and responsive design elements, which creates a light and refined ambiance in the help center. It follows the latest trends in web design and features a brand-new layout with a long list of features.

Zendesk WFM

New:

  • Audit Logs for Account Settings, User Management, and General Tasks. 

Products with no updates this week

  • Talk
  • Support
  • Chat and messaging
  • Admin Center
  • Explore
  • Mobile
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: Explore recipe: Adding images and animated GIFs to dashboards
articles.title: Explore recipe: Adding images and animated GIFs to dashboards
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Suite Professional, Enterprise, or Enterprise Plus
Support with Explore Professional or Enterprise
The information in this article covers the new Explore dashboard builder, released in November 2024. The legacy dashboard builder will remain available until Q4 2025. If you’re using the legacy dashboard builder and need help, see About the legacy Explore dashboard builder.

The new Explore dashboard doesn't support adding images (though this is planned for a future release). However, with a bit of work, you can add images and animated GIFS to your dashboard. Adding graphics can help you brand your dashboards or add instructional material using animated GIFS.

Here's an example:

Important: When you add images using the method in this recipe, you cannot export the dashboard or schedule deliveries.

In this recipe, you'll learn how to add images and animated GIFS to an Explore dashboard.

This recipe contains the following topics:

  • What you'll need
  • Getting the images ready
  • Creating the report attributes
  • Building the report
  • Building the dashboard
  • Next steps

What you'll need

Skill level: Intermediate

Time required: 20 minutes

  • Zendesk Explore Professional or Enterprise.
  • Editor or Admin permissions (see Giving agents access to Explore).
  • One or more images or animated GIFS hosted on the web in an accessible location.

Getting the images ready

You'll create each image as a separate report and then add them to your dashboard. Use the following steps to get your images ready to add.

To prepare your images

  1. Resize your image to ensure it doesn't take up too much space on the dashboard. You can't resize the image from the dashboard, so it might take some trial and error to get it to the size that looks best.
  2. Upload your image to an online location accessible to any of your dashboard viewers. For example, you could use Postimages or imgBB to host your images.
  3. Create a new dashboard. Alternatively, you can use an existing dashboard to add images.

Creating the report attributes

You need to create a report for each image you want to add. In this example, you'll create the reports using the Support - Tickets dataset, but you can use any dataset you want.

To create the reports

  1. In Explore, click the reports ( ) icon.
  2. In the Reports library, click New report.
  3. On the Select a dataset page, click Support > Support - Tickets, then click Start report.
    Report builder opens.
  4. In your report, open the Calculations menu (), then click Standard calculated attribute. 
  5. On the Standard calculated attribute page, under Name, enter a name for the attribute, such as Dashboard image. You can change this name later if you want.
  6. In the Formula field, enter or paste one of the following formulas, including the quotes:
    If you want to insert a static image
     
    "<IMG img src=https://<image location>/<image name>>"
    If you want to insert an animated GIF 
    "<IMG img src=https://<image location>/<image name>.gif>"

    Replace <image location> with the URL of your image and replace <image name> with the image file name.

  7. Click the report's title and enter a descriptive name, such as "Myimage".
  8. Click Save.
  9. Continue creating standard calculated attributes for each image you need.

Building the report

Now that you've created your attributes, you can create reports for each image you want to add to a dashboard. 

To build the report

  1. In the Metrics panel of your report, click Add.
  2. From the list of metrics, choose a single metric to add to the report, for example, COUNT(Tickets). This is added because all Explore reports must contain at least one metric. Don't worry; you'll learn how to hide it later.
  3. In the Attributes panel, click Add.
    Choose the attribute you created in the previous section from the list of attributes. 
  4. Click the Visualization type menu () and select Table. Your report will resemble the following screenshot:
  5. You'll notice that the value of your created metric is displayed. To hide this metric, from the Chart configuration menu ( ), click Columns.
  6. On the Columns page, click the eye icon for column 2 to turn off the column display as shown below:

Your report is now displayed without the metric.

Repeat this procedure for any other images or animated GIFS you need.

Building the dashboard

You now have the components you need to build your dashboard. You can add any other Explore components, such as reports and filters, as well as your images and animated GIFS.

To build the dashboard

  1. In a new or existing Explore dashboard, click the + icon, then select Report.
  2. Click the image reports you just created from the list of reports. The reports immediately appear in the dashboard.
  3. Drag, drop, and resize each report to appear as you want.
  4. Continue adding other reports and filters you need.
  5. When you're done, publish and share the dashboard.

It's likely that when you first add the images and GIFS to the dashboard, they will not be the size you need. To fix this, edit the report, then, in the Chart configuration menu ( ), click Chart and adjust the Height and Width until the image is the right size.

Next steps

Feel free to experiment with this recipe. We'd love to see what you come up with! Let us know in the comments below.

articles.name: Service Incident - April 4th, 2025
articles.title: Service Incident - April 4th, 2025
articles.body:
SUMMARY

April 05, 2025 02:13 AM UTC | April 04, 2025 07:13 PM PT
We have been working continuously with our partner provider to address the issue causing Meta apps (Facebook and Instagram) to become unauthorized in Zendesk. We are pleased to report functionality has been restored. If you are experiencing connectivity issues with your Facebook Pages integration, we encourage you to reconnect the pages to your account. Please let us know if there continue to be any errors or issues. Thank you.

Our teams are still working with our partner provider to address the issue causing Meta apps (Facebook and Instagram) to become unauthorized in Zendesk. We apologize for any disruption this may be causing and thank you for your continued patience. We will post additional information as soon as we have a substantive update to share.

We are continuously investigating the issue with Meta apps (Facebook and Instagram) being unauthorized in Zendesk Support. Our third-party partners are actively investigating on their end to mitigate the issue. We appreciate your patience and understanding on this ongoing issue. We will provide updates as it becomes available.

April 04, 2025 12:50 PM UTC | April 04, 2025 05:50 AM PT
We have discovered that the issue with Facebook being unauthorized in Zendesk Support has extended to other Meta apps (Instagram). Our team is currently investigating the issue. We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your patience and understanding. We will provide updates as it becomes available.

April 04, 2025 11:33 AM UTC | April 04, 2025 04:33 AM PT
We are still investigating the extent of the issue with the Facebook app showing unauthorized in Zendesk Support issue at the moment. Our team is close to identifying the underlying cause and are engaged with our third party support. We appreciate your patience on this ongoing issue and will provide the next update as it becomes available.

April 04, 2025 10:57 AM UTC | April 04, 2025 03:57 AM PT
We are investigating the issue of Facebook pages becoming unauthorized in Zendesk Support on multiple pods. Our team is currently identifying the underlying cause. Thank you for your patience. Next update in 30 minutes.

April 04, 2025 10:25 AM UTC | April 04, 2025 03:25 AM PT
We have received reports of Facebook pages becoming unauthorized in Zendesk Support on multiple pods. Investigation is underway. Please consider replying to your Facebook end users in Facebook for the time being. Next update in 30 mins.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

articles.name: Managing advanced settings for advanced AI agents
articles.title: Managing advanced settings for advanced AI agents
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Add-on AI agents - Advanced

On the Advanced settings page for your advanced AI agent, client admins can manage the website your AI agent is integrated with, the allowlist of IPs able to connect your AI agent and CRM, and the internal comment about your AI agent.

This article contains the following topics:
  • Managing the AI agent's website integration
  • Managing the AI agent's allowlist
  • Adding an internal comment about your AI agent
Related articles:
  • Accessing and viewing settings for advanced AI agents

Managing the AI agent's website integration

In your AI agent’s advanced settings, you must list the website the AI agent should be served from. This is the website where your AI agent should appear and interact with users.

To manage the AI agent website integration
  1. In AI agents - Advanced, in the top-right corner, use the AI agent drop-down field to select the AI agent you want to manage the website integration for.
  2. In the left sidebar, click Settings > AI agent settings.
  3. Click the Advanced settings tab.
  4. Under Website integration, in Subdomain, enter the subdomain of the website that your AI agent should appear on.
  5. In Frame ancestors, enter the website that’s allowed to render a webpage in an <iframe>, <object>, <embed>, or <applet> HTML element.

    This enhances the security of your site by helping to protect against clickjacking attacks.

  6. Click Save.

Managing the AI agent's allowlist

The allowlist is a list of IPs that are allowed to connect your AI agent to your customer relationship management (CRM) platform or other trusted systems.

For details and a list of specific IPs to add, see Allowing IPs to connect advanced AI agents to your CRM.

Adding an internal comment about your AI agent

You can add an internal-only comment about your advanced AI agent. This is a helpful way to record specific information about your AI agent (such as setup details that aren’t captured elsewhere) that’s relevant for anyone with access to manage this AI agent.

To add an internal comment about your AI agent
  1. In AI agents - Advanced, in the top-right corner, use the AI agent drop-down field to select the AI agent you want to add an internal comment about.
  2. In the left sidebar, click Settings > AI agent settings.
  3. Click the Advanced settings tab.
  4. Under Comments, in Add a comment, enter the internal-only information you want to record.

  5. Click Save.

articles.name: Scheduled Maintenance Period - May - September 2025 | Migration of Workforce Management (WFM) Accounts
articles.title: Scheduled Maintenance Period - May - September 2025 | Migration of Workforce Management (WFM) Accounts
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance which will impact WFM product availability for accounts created before February 13, 2025. These accounts are migrating to a new environment to enhance the scalability and reliability of our WFM services, ensuring a better experience for all users. During the migration process, all WFM functionalities will be temporarily unavailable for up to 1.5 hours.

Affected products: Workforce Management (WFM)

Customers Affected: Only customers with WFM enabled will be impacted. Timing will be communicated to customers through in-product messaging in Support approximately 2 weeks prior to account’s migration.

Expected behavior: During the migration process, all WFM functionalities will be temporarily unavailable for up to 1.5 hours. Please note that migrations will only occur during weeknights to minimize disruption during peak usage hours. We understand that this may cause some inconvenience, and we appreciate your patience as we work to improve our services.

What do customers have to do? No action is required, this notice is to inform of an expected downtime of WFM functionality during the migration. Please contact Zendesk Support with questions or concerns and we will be happy to assist.

Why we're doing this: The primary goal of this transition is to enhance the scalability and reliability of our WFM services.

articles.name: Why are there discrepancies between an Explore query and a Support view when I filter by days in the past?
articles.title: Why are there discrepancies between an Explore query and a Support view when I filter by days in the past?
articles.body:
Question

I am trying to compare tickets in Explore and Support views. I  use a date range based on days in the past. Why are there discrepancies?

Answer

The time filter In the past x days in the Support view starts the count from the current timestamp up to x days in the past by the hour. If you select In the past 7 days in the Request date field, the Support view displays tickets that match the criteria from the last 168 hours. In Explore, the filter x days in the past takes into account the matching criteria at 00:00 hours of the first day of the time range and it ends on the 23:59h of the last day in the filter. Instead, to compare a view from Support and query in Explore, use the Explore time filter x hours in the past.

For more details, check this article: Troubleshooting reporting and data discrepancies in Explore

articles.name: Why do SLA badges disappear on tickets unexpectedly?
articles.title: Why do SLA badges disappear on tickets unexpectedly?
articles.body:
Question

Why do SLA badges disappear on tickets unexpectedly?

Answer

When multiple triggers run simultaneously to update a ticket, race conditions may occur. This may happen if a trigger's actions include an autoreply that adds or modifies a field on a ticket and other triggers rely on such field.

As a result, this may affect whether an SLA policy, also known as service level agreement, matches the ticket and create inconsistencies in the SLA badge. SLA policy calculations are not asynchronous and don't account for the order of events. Consequently, the target may have fired on the ticket and you can see these changes in the UI and in the Ticket Audits API, but the badge may not display as expected.

For more information, see these articles:

  • Troubleshooting common SLA issues
  • Can I use a trigger and a webhook to update tickets?

articles.name: Error appears when light agent tries to log in
articles.title: Error appears when light agent tries to log in
articles.body:
Issue symptoms

The following error appears when light agent tries to log in: Password entered does not meet the following requirements Reassign tickets assigned to this agent. Password: is invalid.

Resolution steps

Light agents may see this error if they're the assignee on an active ticket. Light agents can't be the assignee of a ticket. To ensure that light agents are not assigned tickets, Zendesk prevents access to their account or update of their credentials while they are listed as the assignee on active tickets. To resolve this, you can either

  • Reassign all tickets which have the light agent as assignee
  • Upgrade the light agent's role

For more information, see the article: Understanding and setting light agent permissions

articles.name: Announcing improvements to User Identities API for trustworthy email verification
articles.title: Announcing improvements to User Identities API for trustworthy email verification
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
April 3, 2025 April 3, 2025 April 11, 2025

As of today, we’re introducing two new properties to the User Identities API that will help provide clarity and trust as to whether a user has verified their email address, including how and when that verification took place. With this update, you’ll be able to track the method of verification to understand if the email address is a reliable point of contact and one that the user has access to.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What’s changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What’s changing?

We’re adding two new properties to the User Identities API: verification_method and verified_at. The verified_at property returns the date and time when verification_method is updated to "full". It does not update for other values and clears if the verification_method changes from "full" to any other value. Both properties are read-only and can only be set by Zendesk.

Below is a description of the verification_method property, its possible values, and the resulting verified property value. 

verification_method property

Description

verified property

none

An email address has been added to a user’s profile, but without proof of ownership

verified=false

low

An agent or an API request has set the email as verified

verified=true

sso

The Identity Provider (IdP) has included the email as part of the single sign-on (SSO) login flow

verified=true

If your SSO is configured using OpenID Connect, we will respect the value that’s passed in the email_verified claim.

embed

The email was provided in a JWT as part of an embedded Web Widget or SDK login flow. See Setting up user authentication for messaging

verified=true

full

Zendesk has completed an email verification flow first hand

verified=true

 

Why is Zendesk making this change?

Currently, an email address identity on the User Identities API that’s marked as "verified=true" doesn’t specify the method used for verification, leading to uncertainty about whether a verified email address is actually trustworthy. With these new properties, we’re going to change that. Here’s how they’ll benefit you:

  • You’ll know how each email was verified—by a team member, through an external system, or directly by Zendesk. This helps you decide which email addresses you can trust.
  • When an email is marked as verified through the "full" verification method, it indicates that the user has demonstrated that they can access that email inbox. This gives you confidence that you’re reaching a real person.

What do I need to do?

You don’t need to take any action. The new properties are available for you to consume if you so choose.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Why are my proactive messages not working?
articles.title: Why are my proactive messages not working?
articles.body:
Question

I am using Web Widget or mobile SDK channels with JWT authentication and have configured multiple proactive messages. Why does the customer only receive one proactive message? Additionally, if they log out and log back in, why are no proactive messages displayed?

Answer

When using proactive messages in Messaging, these messages are linked to the status of the conversation. Proactive messages only trigger when the user is not engaged with a human agent or an AI agent.

If you have configured multiple proactive messages, only the first one will activate. Subsequent proactive messages will not trigger because the user remains in an active conversation with the AI or human agent from the initial proactive message.

When using JWT for messaging authentication, this behavior applies across all devices. Accessing the service from a different device will not prompt a new proactive message.

When a ticket is closed, they will be eligible to receive new proactive messages.

For users interacting with an AI agent or bot, the legacy bot can only trigger new proactive messages if there has been no engagement for more than 72 hours.

For more information, see the articles:

  • Creating proactive messages for mobile SDK channels
  • Creating proactive messages for the Web Widget
